subject: Technology
title: The First Mobile Phone Call
description: One-minute skill: The First Mobile Phone Call.

hook.text: On April 3, 1973, Martin Cooper stood on a New York sidewalk and made a call on a brick-sized phone.

buildup.text: He called his rival at Bell Labs, just to let him know Motorola had beaten them to it.

discovery.text: That first mobile phone weighed over a kilogram and its battery lasted just 20 minutes.

twist.text: It took another ten years before mobile phones reached consumers. The first one cost $3,995.

climax.text: Cooper's sidewalk call started a race that would eventually put a computer in every pocket on Earth.

punchline.text: The first mobile call was a flex on a competitor.

quiz.question: Who did Martin Cooper call with the first mobile phone?
